articles.title: A woman with HIV had the coronavirus for 216 days – and it mutated at least 30 times - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Scientist detected 32 virus mutations in the woman's body, including some seen in variants of concern. It's unclear if she passed on any of them.
articles.content:
A 36-year-old woman with advanced HIV carried the novel coronavirus for 216 days, during which the virus accumulated more than 30 mutations, a new study has found.

articles.title: Hero Rat Magawa Is Retiring From A Career Of Sniffing Out Land Mines In Cambodia - NPR
articles.description: Magawa is credited with saving lives. The African giant pouched rat has found 71 land mines and 38 items of unexploded ordnance. Now, he has reached retirement age after five years of service.
articles.content:
Magawa is shown here working to detect land mines, a job the animal has done for five years.
APOPO
